intro: Legousia castellana var. longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled legousia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of hair. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
